meanings.definition: To make something secure or fasten with battens.
meanings.sent1: She was battening the door to keep it from swinging in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was battening the roof to protect it from the storm.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was battening the nuts in place to prevent them from rolling away.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was battening the plants to the trellis for support.
meanings.sent5: The sailor was battening down the hatches before the storm hit.

meanings.sent1: The cat was battening on the rich cream and getting plump.
meanings.sent2: The bear was battening on the salmon in the river to prepare for hibernation.
meanings.sent3: The pig was battening happily on the fallen apples in the orchard.
meanings.sent4: The cow was battening on the lush grass in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was battening on the nuts to store up for winter.

meanings.sent1: The geese were battening as they feasted on the grains in the field.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit was battening on the carrots and growing rounder by the day.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was battening on the leftovers from the picnic and getting chubby.
meanings.sent4: The deer was battening on the fallen apples and gaining weight for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was battening on the acorns and becoming plumper for the cold season.
